author: Staff Reporter
text:
Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam president M. Karunanidhi could not unseat All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam general secretary Jayalalithaa from power as the large number of welfare and development schemes implemented by her government would bring her victory in the May 16 Assembly elections, said State Minister for Social Welfare Valarmathi.

Addressing an election meeting near Anna Stadium here on Saturday night, she listed the welfare schemes implemented by the AIADMK government for women, including the announcement on 50 per cent reservation for women in local bodies.

The Minister also criticised the statements made by Desiya Murpokku Dravida Kazhagam women’s wing leader Premalatha Vijayakant, and said that she was giving wrong promises such as distribution of PDS goods at the doorsteps of the people.

Referring to a statement made by Congress national Spokesperson Kushbhu that the ‘two leaves’ (AIADMK party symbol) would wither and the sun (DMK party symbol) would rise again in the State in the Assembly elections, Ms. Valarmathi said ‘two leaves’ had grown into a banyan tree under the able governance of Ms. Jayalalithaa. She said that the winning symbol was introduced by AIADMK founder and former Chief Minister M.G. Ramachandran.

Minister for Handlooms and Textiles S. Gokula Indira also addressed. Former Minister N. Thalavai Sundaram presided over the meeting.

Minister lists welfare schemes implemented by

the government

for women
title: “Govt.’s welfare schemes will ensure AIADMK’s victory”
